title: Internal Compiler Error after moving a module

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust There is no indication of where the failure occurs in the code. It just stopped compiling and throws that error. I moved a module from one folder to another, I fixed the import paths. Then, when I try to compile it comes up with that error. ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c commit-date: 2021-11-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.57.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: could not compile `dev_soft_account`; 7 warnings emitted ```
Backtrace
